qas.question: Which country gave Yugoslavia aid when Tito became estranged from the USSR?
What agency distributed aid to Yugoslavia?
What plan was also administered by the ECA?
Which leader feared that accepting American aid meant aligning with the West?
In what year did Stalin die?

context: <a3_0>Tito<a3_0/>'s estrangement from the USSR enabled Yugoslavia to obtain <a0_0>US<a0_0/> aid via the Economic Cooperation Administration (<a1_0>ECA<a1_0/>), the same US aid institution which administered the <a2_0>Marshall Plan<a2_0/>. Still, he did not agree to align with the West, which was a common consequence of accepting American aid at the time. After Stalin's death in <a4_0>1953<a4_0/>, relations with the USSR were relaxed and he began to receive aid as well from the COMECON. In this way, Tito played East-West antagonism to his advantage. Instead of choosing sides, he was instrumental in kick-starting the Non-Aligned Movement, which would function as a 'third way' for countries interested in staying outside of the East-West divide.
